column4: Oh, by the way, how many people would be interested in an Epiphany extension which lets you load/unload other extensions? This question is for Ubuntu devs, too, since it'd mean repackaging of epiphany-extensions... and would be obselete by the time Epiphany 1.6 comes out
(The functionality is already in 1.5, but we could backport it to 1.4 if it were considered extremely useful)
1.5 will be in hoary anyway
I'll probably ignore it, then. It's really a dead-end development-wise.
me too, in certain ways; there was a lot of discussion about it pre-warty.
I know, I read the ML
multiverse == contrib/non-free and a bunch of other stuff
Oh, okay, so it's got java-package, nice :)
Problem is, the ML discussion really didn't say what Epiphany can possibly do to become default in Hoary
the discussion was mostly before the preview
no
try it.
Hrm... how often does this RSS thingy update? Maybe it is cool ;)
no, zvt was difficult to read (codewise) and didn't do i18n/utf-8 or a11y.
Ah. I knew it was hopeless :)
it wasn't.
Do you think vte could be optimized?
sure.
if you're comfortable running a debian sid system, and you know how to fix one when it breaks, hoary will be only slightly more challenging.
using hoary?
Thanks for your help. Later :)
